summary: The SEAS Act aims to support the aquaculture and seafood industries by directing the Department of Agriculture (USDA) to prioritize equity for aquaculture producers in grant programs, conduct internal education on aquaculture, and provide funding for research and development. The bill mandates reports on USDA spending related to seafood/aquaculture, defines relevant terms, focuses on promoting the industry. It also includes provisions for shellfish research, development of next-generation technology, and crop insurance for aquaculture products.
